body: This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1156)

comment_data.body: I think this is already in master, no? Perhaps rebase so it doesn't appear in this PR?
No, I closed that PR. This change is only needed for saving.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,13 +102,13 @@ actually make more sense in the implementation to have a separate list for
 frozen peers.
 
 ## Saving
-Saving could be implemented by simply saving all live groups with their group
-numbers and full peer info for all peers. On reload, all peers would be set as
-frozen.
+Saving is implemented by simply saving all live groups with their group numbers
+and full peer info for all peers. On reload, all peers are set as frozen.
 
-The client would need to support this by understanding that these groups exist
-on start-up (e.g. starting windows for them), and by not automatically killing
-groups on closing the client.
+Clients needs to support this by understanding that groups may exist on
+start-up. Clients should call tox\_conference\_get\_chatlist to obtain them. A

comment_data.body: Add "." at the end (or remove it from all the others).
This is horrible, but ok.. similar to the rest that is also horrible.
This is not ideal. Are we not setting every field of `Group_Peer` explicitly while loading it?
Yes, well... Can you see a way to make it less horrible, without redoing the save system entirely?
Well, this is also how the peer structure is initialised in addpeer. Should I add an initialisation function to be used in both places, explicitly setting the various fields to 0?

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -102,13 +102,13 @@ actually make more sense in the implementation to have a separate list for
 frozen peers.
 
 ## Saving
-Saving could be implemented by simply saving all live groups with their group
-numbers and full peer info for all peers. On reload, all peers would be set as
-frozen.
+Saving is implemented by simply saving all live groups with their group numbers
+and full peer info for all peers. On reload, all peers are set as frozen.
 
-The client would need to support this by understanding that these groups exist
-on start-up (e.g. starting windows for them), and by not automatically killing
-groups on closing the client.
+Clients needs to support this by understanding that groups may exist on
+start-up. Clients should call tox\_conference\_get\_chatlist to obtain them. A

comment_data.body: Let's leave this as it is.

Are these CI fails because of this PR or did they exist before?

* Tuesday, 2018-10-30 at 11:13 -0700 - sudden6 <notifications@github.com>:

>Are these CI fails because of this PR or did they exist before?

The tsan failure is a long-standing problem. The Cirrus failure was due 
to a complaint about this PR (it didn't like a variable being used only 
for an assertion) which I've now fixed. At the time of writing it's 
failing again, but that's just because the tcp test intermittently fails 
(another long-standing problem).
@iphydf Your lgtm seems to block this PR, what is your current state with this?

commit.message:
Implement conferences saving

* add global friend_connection status callback, used for group rejoining
* stop leaving groups on killing tox
